column4: Hey all, I was in here last night and asked about whether Ubuntu could resize an NTFS partition. I was told it could, but that it could not format it. Therefore from this I gather if I used Ubuntu to resize my NFTS partition, it wouldn't be able to install itself on the one part of this? Cheers.
because resizing it would leave HDD free space, and then you just create a new partition
So Ubuntu should be able to make my two NTFS partitions smaller and then install Ubuntu in the free space (not forgetting the SWAP partition)?
